text: Sending my warmest wishes to all who are celebrating Kwanzaa in the United States and around the world. May your days be filled with peace, love, and happiness.
@AliseNavidad Keep me updated 😉
Teachers are doing some of the most important work in the entire country. They should not be scraping by and taking two or three jobs. They should be paid at least $60,000 a year.
Someone had a bit too much Christmas dinner! http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EMvU-upUEAAgj5P.jpg

No one inside the Beltway seems to ask how much the status quo costs. I'll tell you. Each year:

• 100,000 Americans die from air pollution
• Thousands die for lack of health insurance
 
We have the resources—and a moral obligation—to pass Medicare for All and a Green New Deal.

Taxpayers have paid $115 million so Donald Trump could play golf at his own resorts.

Amazon got $129 million in tax rebates last year.

Meanwhile, the average person in poverty gets just $134 a month in nutrition assistance.

This is what a rigged economy looks like.
Wishing a happy, reflective and peaceful week to everyone observing Kwanzaa.

Best wishes to everyone gathering together to light the kinara for the first night of Kwanzaa. Tonight's principle is my personal favorite—umoja or unity. Our nation desperately needs more of it. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EMuc6gnWwAA4fdk.png
Bruce and I are wishing a very happy Kwanzaa to everyone celebrating this week!

Having private health insurance doesn’t mean a damn thing if you have a $5,000 deductible that you can’t afford. 

That is why Medicare for All will eliminate deductibles, along with co-payments and premiums.
Have you put off buying a home or starting a family due to medical debt or student loans?
We must become a nation where all our people are able to live long and healthy lives—not just those with the means to afford outrageous health care costs.

Americans are finding that they have more month at the end of their money than money at the end of their month. My Rise Credit would benefit nearly half of all Americans by putting cash into their pockets to help with the rising cost of living.
Prior to our Congress #ForThePeople, it had been years since the House considered legislation to #EndGunViolence. That ended this year, with the passage of #HR8, the Bipartisan Background Checks Act.

I was a pro-labor mayor, now I'm a pro-labor senator—and if you send me to the White House, I'll be a pro-labor president. https://corybooker.com/issues/economic-security-and-opportunity/opportunity-and-justice-for-workers/
A very happy #Kwanzaa to all who are celebrating in California and across the country! May your life be filled with community and joy.

There are a lot of lies peddled by the insurance and drug industries about Medicare for All.

Don't believe them.

Here is the truth: Medicare for All will save the American people money and end the disgrace of our profit-driven system. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1210218173737455616/img/F6VWYmm15UYzoFbU.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1210218173737455616/vid/320x320/lVCvBxEUdv8oV3pN.mp4?tag=13

Trump is going to be a formidable opponent. But despair is not an option. We are going to organize, bring millions of people into the political process, and win.

See, days are coming when I will raise up a righteous branch for David; As king he shall reign and govern wisely,he shall do what is just and right in the land.

Jeremiah 23:5

A political revolution is underway. 

On January 1, thanks to millions of working people engaging at all levels of government, 21 states and 26 localities will raise the minimum wage.

This is the largest number of states, cities and counties raising the wage in American history. https://twitter.com/NelpNews/status/1209109609170063361 QT @NelpNews BREAKING: A new report from @NELPNews’ @YannetYannet shows that a RECORD NUMBER of states, cities, and counties are raising their minimum wage this January! #FightFor15 #RaiseTheWage #2020 Read more: https://www.nelp.org/publication/raises-coast-coast-2020/

If you make it big—and I mean really big, top one‑tenth of one percent big—pitch in a few cents so everyone else gets a chance to make it, too. 

It’s really that simple.

The best way to grow the economy isn't by giving more money to billionaires and corporations already sitting on piles of money, but by helping working families struggling with the costs of health care, child care, housing, and education.  https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-10-21/taxing-the-rich-to-fund-welfare-is-nobel-winner-s-growth-mantra

There is something fundamentally wrong when we are spending twice as much per capita on health care as other major countries and our average life expectancy is going DOWN.
There is no middle ground in terms of dealing with climate change. This is about millions of people losing their homes, jobs and lives. We need a Green New Deal.

We're closing out the decade with a widening wealth gap and millions of families drowning in debt due to the costs of health care and higher education. 

In 2020, let's fight for big, structural change to build an economy that works for everyone. https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/venessawong/the-great-recession-broke-the-american-economy-we-still
